channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Is extreme cold causing trees to explode in the US?
Fund withdrawals via UPI and more: How EPFO 3.0 brings good news for employees
Why Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau’s Davos appearance became controversial
How Azerbaijan is emerging as new third arm of Pakistan-Turkey nexus against India
Did US give Greenland to Denmark? Fact-checking Donald Trump's Davos speech
Greenland or Iceland, ‘stupid people’ and more… Takeaways from Trump’s Davos speech
Is Trump bluffing on Iran or serious? History has a lesson for him
item.description: If the decades-long animosity with Iran has taught the US anything, it is that interference in the Islamic Republic’s internal or foreign affairs backfires

item.title: Shadow Warrior | Donald Trump and global disorder: The unravelling of the old world order has begun
item.description: The year 2026 will be worse for all concerned. Centrifugal forces are going to tear up globalism, and a narrow nationalism may not bode well for anybody

item.title: India is a ‘dharma democracy’ but this doesn’t make it any less democratic or liberal: Salvatore Babones
item.description: India fares very poorly in global democracy rankings not because the problems are worse in the country, but because Indians can discuss their problems without fear, says author Salvatore Babones

item.title: Takaichi’s snap election gamble: A pivotal moment for Japanese politics
item.description: By moving early, Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi intends to consolidate her leadership, gain popular endorsement for her fiscal and security policies, and strengthen her party’s legislative power. Yet the risks are just as significant

item.title: How India’s EU trade deal could reshape global alignments
item.description: In a world of quicksand alliances, India’s EU pivot could be the firm ground needed for real growth and security.

item.title: Taming Trump: Why India-EU trade deal matters strategically too
item.description: The India-EU trade deal, likely to be inked in the coming days, would be a gamechanger and could counter Trump’s attempts to pressurise Europe into towing his line whether on trade matters, Ukraine war or Greenland
